revised_title: A New Perspective on Striated Muscular Fibre Development in Mammalia
tldr: The author presents a new theory on the development of striated muscular fibers in mammals, challenging the previously accepted understanding. The research involves the study of fetal pigs, calves, lambs, goats, rabbits, rats, and human embryos, and the findings suggest that the nuclei in the muscle fibers are not contained within cells.
